errors.cors: The Image API endpoint in the manifest does not support CORS for images, falling back to server-side PDF generation.
errors.no_clientside: Your browser does not support generating PDFs on its own, so the app will fall back to a server.
errors.pdf_failure_conn: Failed to generate PDF: Could not connect to server at {apiEndpoint}
errors.invalid_canvas_range_bad_index: Invalid canvas range: {range}, only values between 1 and {canvasCount} are allowed.

pdfgen.image-download-failure: {numFailed} {numFailed, plural, one {an image}, other {{numFailed} images}} on page {canvasIndex} could not be downloaded, they will be missing from the page.
pdfgen.image-download-failure-all: None of the images on page {canvasIndex} could be downloaded, the page will be empty.
pdfgen.ocr-download-failure: Failed to download OCR for page {canvasIndex}, it will not have selectable text.

notifications.filesystem_supported: Congratulations, your browser supports generating PDFs! Don't be irritated when you don't see a download, the PDF will be saved to the path you specified nevertheless.
notifications.large_pdf: PDF might be too large to be generated in this browser. You can force client-side generation (faster, at the risk of possibly crashing your browser tab), or have the PDF be generated on the server (slower, subject to limits).
notifications.server_generation: PDF is being generated on the server. If you want to have faster downloads and a smaller likelihood of running into limits, consider using Chrome/Chromium Desktop or Edge, which support generating large PDFs in the browser.
notifications.queued: Looks like other users are also generating PDFs from the IIIF services at {iiifHost}, you'll have to wait until a spot in the queue becomes available. If you want to avoid this, use a browser that supports the File System Access API, like Chrome, Chromium or Edge.

buttons.notify: Notify me when the PDF is ready

unload_warning: Leaving this page will terminate the current download. Are you sure you want to close this page?
